channel.title: Compile.Bat
channel.description:
[b]Im Been Having Trouble With Making A Hamachi Server Im At The Last Part Were I Right Click Compile.bat And Click Edit But I Dont See Any Edit And Wene I Open It A Black Box Pops-up and Says[/b]
"[i]Javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . . _[/i]"
[b]And a Community Member Is Helping Me, So He Said It Couldnt Find My Java Files So He Send Me A URL To This Website To Download This[/b]
"[i]JDK 6 The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools that are useful for developing applets and applications.[/i]"
[b]So Then I Downloaded It And It Still Says The Samething, So Am Kinda Lost[/b]

item.title: Compile.Bat
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

You need to put:

javac -cp . *.java

The . is for the current directory. If you don’t have that, then no your files won’t be found.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile.Bat
item.dc:creator: @craids craids
item.description:
@craids wrote:

Hmm…Some computers don’t allow Java without setting the classpath (like mine -.-).
I’v never seen a “Javac file not found” maybe its the same thing as not recognized?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile.Bat
item.dc:creator: @Fernando_Pena Fernando Pena
item.description:
@Fernando_Pena wrote:

Im Been Having Trouble With Making A Hamachi Server Im At The Last Part Were I Right Click Compile.bat And Click Edit But I Dont See Any Edit And Wene I Open It A Black Box Pops-up and Says

“Javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue . . . _”

And a Community Member Is Helping Me, So He Said It Couldnt Find My Java Files So He Send Me A URL To This Website To Download This

“JDK 6
The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools that are useful for developing applets and applications.”

So Then I Downloaded It And It Still Says The Samething, So Am Kinda Lost

Read full topic
